title: Maleficent's Angelina Jolie poses with her kids on red carpet in Rome
text:
Shiloh and Zahara joined their mum on the red carpet (Picture: Getty Images)

Angelina Jolie has been joined by her children once again on the red carpet at her latest Maleficent premiere, as they continued to support their mother on her promotional tour.

The mother-of-six has had her kids by her side at various events recently, including eldest Maddox, 18, who joined her at the Tokyo premiere from university in Seoul.

Now the 44-year-old actress has daughters Shiloh, 13, and Zahara, 14, supporting her on the red carpet of the European premiere in Rome.

Earlier on Monday Ange, who shares her brood with ex-husband Brad Pitt, wore a luminous purple outfit during a photocall alongside co-star Michelle Pfeiffer.

However, for the evening event she slipped back into her classic black wardrobe for the beaming shots alongside her children.

Sporting a gorgeous black, strapless gown, she had strands of her hair tied back with the rest hanging over her shoulders, along with a pair of drop-earrings.

Her family have been with her at each premiere (Picture: Getty Images)

Alongside co-star Michelle Pfeiffer (Picture: Getty Images)

Ange’s other kids, Pax, 15, and 11-year-old twins Vivienne and Knox, weren’t fronting up for this event but perhaps we’ll see them at the next premiere, eh?

The star recently had the full support of her family – minus Maddox – on the Maleficent 2 press trail last week, with the kids accompanying Ange to the Los Angeles premiere.

It wasn’t just the children who posed up a storm alongside lead actress Angelina this time around, though, with Michelle cosying up to her colleague for some snaps.

She earlier rocked this number at a press call (Picture: WENN.com)

Wearing a velvety blue dress, Michelle wrapped an arm around Ange as they smiled for the cameras.

Five years after first donning the evil fairy’s horns in 2014, Ange returns as Maleficent in soon-to-be-released Mistress Of Evil, this time fighting for the love of Princess Aurora (Elle Fanning).

She meets her match in the form of Queen Ingrith (played by Michelle) who causes drama of explosive proportions when her son Prince Phillip proposes to Aurora.

Ahead of the release, Ange has spoken about the similarities between her own struggles and that of Maleficent’s, referencing the breakdown of her marriage to Brad Pitt in 2016.

Brad and Angelina got married in 2014 and quickly became one of Hollywood’s most beloved couples, before splitting two years later, 11 years after they first started dating.

Ange split from Brad in 2016 (Picture: Getty Images for AFI)

When asked last week if she believed in fate, she explained: ‘I don’t what my fate holds but what I am convinced of is that I am in a period of transition, like a return to my roots, a return to myself. Because, I had lost myself a bit.’

‘I felt a deep and genuine sadness, I was hurt. On the other hand, it was interesting to reconnect with this humility and even this insignificance I was feeling. Maybe this is what being human is in the end… On top of all this, I suffered some health issues. All these things settle in you and remind you of how lucky you are of being alive.’

Speaking to French magazine Madame, the mum-of-six went on to say that rediscovering joy is a lesson she wants to teach her children.

Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil is in UK cinemas 18 October.
